Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti of Rekhmira called Panehesy with a yellow and blue(?) striped lappet wig, a red and yellow face, a yellow and blue collar, crossed hands in relief with yellow and blue bracelets, the legs are inscribed with six visible rows of yellow painted hieroglyphs, the whole figure is thickly varnished(now worn).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
